name: Intergraf European Federation for Print and Digital Communication
membership:
Intergraf is a member of and has the secretariat of the 
World Print & Communication Forum which is the international organisation representing the printing industries with members in the US & Canada, Japan, China, Hong Kong, India, Australia, Korea, Brazil and Europe. www.worldprintforum.org
goal: Intergraf represents 21 national printing federations in 19 countries in Europe. Intergraf's main task is to promote and enhance the interests of the printing and digital communication industry, working with the European Institutions to support the sectors' competitiveness. Intergraf covers a wide range of European policies related to the graphic industry in areas such as Competitiveness, Economics, Image, Environment, Health & Safety and Education. Intergraf is the source of information for its members regarding the different policies of the European Union affecting the print value chain. The printing industry in the 28 European countries comprises some 118,000 firms and employs some 630,000 people with a turnover of â‚¬80 billion. Intergraf is also involved in security printing and acts as an international platform for security printing technology and certification.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Environment, Information Society, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation
euInitiatives: Intergraf covers a wide range of European policies related to the graphic industry in areas such as Competitiveness, SMEs, Economics, Image, Environment, Health & Safety and Education. Intergraf also covers topcis related to security printing such as the production of ID documents, passports, tax banderoles, stamps as well as banknotes. Intergraf offers a certification management of security printing processes in order to ensure a secure production from ordering to delivery.
